"Psychic Experiment" is a classic science fiction movie directed by William Friedkin. The movie tells the story of a group of individuals who are sent to a remote island in order to test the efficacy of a new drug that has been developed by a pharmaceutical company.
Throughout the course of their experiment, the group of individuals becomes increasingly obsessed with the efficacy of the new drug and with the potential consequences of their experiment on both society at large and the specific pharmaceutical company for which they have been hired.
Ultimately, "Psychic Experiment" is a powerful and thought-provoking movie that explores themes such as the power of suggestion and belief in alternative realities, as well as issues such as privacy and surveillance, and ethical questions such as the responsibilities and obligations of individuals who are in charge of experimental procedures or other activities that involve potentially dangerous or harmful substances or procedures

Another great option would be "The Adventures of Tom Sawyer." The novel features various memorable characters such as Tom's best friend Ben, Tom's cousin Hattie, Tom's teacher Miss Honey, Tom's neighbor Mrs. Nellie, Tom's boss Mr. Carson, Tom's friend Bob, Tom's enemy Scarecrow, Tom's enemy Marauder, Tom's friend Jerry, and many more memorable characters such as Hattie, Ben, Miss Honey, Mrs. Nellie, Mr. Carson, Bob, Jerry, etc., which are all very memorable and iconic characters in this novel.
